thread.title: SAN BERNARDINO: Officers on lunch break arrest wanted man
thread.title_full: SAN BERNARDINO: Officers on lunch break arrest wanted man - Press Enterprise

author: AARON CLAVERIE
title: SAN BERNARDINO: Officers on lunch break arrest wanted man
text:
AARON CLAVERIE / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 9, 2015 3:24 p.m. SAN BERNARDINO: Officers on lunch break arrest wanted man Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article Â» Two San Bernardino police officers on their lunch break arrested a wanted man who tried to evade capture by hiding in their dining spot.
Jesus Delgado, 23, was booked into the Central Detention Center on suspicion of failure to yield with disregard to safety. His companion, Rebecca Rodriguez, 28, also was arrested on suspicion of failure to yield with disregard to safety.
Officers came into contact with the pair on Thursday morning while they were driving in a vehicle that was reportedly stolen from the city of Fontana.
After realizing he had been spotted, the deputy following the stolen car attempted to make a traffic stop but the vehicle failed to yield.
The car led the deputy on a short pursuit through business parking lots and back onto surface streets. During the chase, the driver, later identified as Rodriguez, reportedly came close to hitting pedestrians.
The pursuit ended when the deputy blocked the vehicle in the area of Vanderbilt Way and Carnegie Drive.
The passenger, later identified as Delgado, jumped out of the car and attempted to flee the area on foot, eventually entering the restaurant that contained the dining officers.
The officers determined his behavior was suspicious and took him into custody.
